data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is all about quality and building endurance while focusing on our technique. We’ll be doing 6 rounds of a mix of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement and keep a steady pace. Remember, it’s not just about getting through the rounds; it’s about doing each movement correctly and efficiently. Let’s break it down!


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • For the rower, sit with your feet strapped in, grab the handle, and start with your knees bent and back straight.
  • Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle to your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body.
  • Reverse the motion: extend your arms, lean forward, and bend your knees to return to the starting position.
  • For the Ski Erg, stand tall, grip the handles, and initiate the movement by pulling down with your arms while engaging your core and legs.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders.
  • Use your legs to drive the movement; your arms should follow.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If you’re new to rowing or skiing, reduce the time to 2:00 or focus on technique rather than speed.

    • 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand in front of the box with your feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through your heel, and bring your other foot up to meet it.
  • Step back down one foot at a time and repeat.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your chest up and engage your core.
  • Use your legs to lift yourself, not your back.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height.
  • You can also perform step-ups without weights to focus on balance and form.

    • 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, kettlebell on the ground between your feet.
  • Hinge at your hips, keeping your back straight, and grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  • Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin, keeping your elbows high.
  • Lower the kettlebell back down to the ground and repeat.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep the kettlebell close to your body throughout the movement.
  • Engage your core and avoid leaning back at the top of the pull.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form.
  • If you’re new to this movement, you can also do a standard deadlift with a lighter weight.

    • 4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Set the rings at a height that allows you to pull yourself up comfortably.
  • Grab the rings with an overhand grip and lean back, keeping your body straight.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then lower yourself back down.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  • Avoid using momentum; focus on controlled movements.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If ring rows are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows using a barbell or a low bar.
  • Alternatively, do seated rows with a resistance band.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Row/Ski: 2:00, Box Step-Ups: 16/8, Kettlebell: 12/8, Ring Rows: 8 reps.

  • **Train:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00, Box Step-Ups: 20 reps, Kettlebell: 16/12, Ring Rows: 10 reps.

  • **Compete:**
  • Row/Ski: 3:00, Box Step-Ups: 20 reps, Kettlebell: 24/16, Ring Rows: 10 reps.

    • Strategy Advice

  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout each round. It’s better to go slower and keep good form than to rush and risk injury.
  • Break the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows.
  • Stay hydrated and listen to your body; if you need to take a breather, that’s perfectly okay!

    • Alright, team! Let’s get ready to crush this WOD with quality and focus. Remember, it’s all about the journey, not just the finish line. Let’s have some fun!

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:


For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds

--- AI EXPLANATION --- ## Workout Overview Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is all about quality and building endurance while focusing on our technique. We’ll be doing 6 rounds of a mix of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement and keep a steady pace. Remember, it’s not just about getting through the rounds; it’s about doing each movement correctly and efficiently. Let’s break it down! ## Workout Components ### 1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00) - **Technique Steps:** - For the rower, sit with your feet strapped in, grab the handle, and start with your knees bent and back straight. - Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle to your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body. - Reverse the motion: extend your arms, lean forward, and bend your knees to return to the starting position. - For the Ski Erg, stand tall, grip the handles, and initiate the movement by pulling down with your arms while engaging your core and legs. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders. - Use your legs to drive the movement; your arms should follow. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - If you’re new to rowing or skiing, reduce the time to 2:00 or focus on technique rather than speed. ### 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand in front of the box with your feet hip-width apart. - Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through your heel, and bring your other foot up to meet it. - Step back down one foot at a time and repeat. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your chest up and engage your core. - Use your legs to lift yourself, not your back. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height. - You can also perform step-ups without weights to focus on balance and form. ### 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, kettlebell on the ground between your feet. - Hinge at your hips, keeping your back straight, and grab the kettlebell with both hands. - Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin, keeping your elbows high. - Lower the kettlebell back down to the ground and repeat. - **Form Tips:** - Keep the kettlebell close to your body throughout the movement. - Engage your core and avoid leaning back at the top of the pull. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form. - If you’re new to this movement, you can also do a standard deadlift with a lighter weight. ### 4. Ring Rows (10 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Set the rings at a height that allows you to pull yourself up comfortably. - Grab the rings with an overhand grip and lean back, keeping your body straight. - Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then lower yourself back down. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. - Avoid using momentum; focus on controlled movements. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - If ring rows are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows using a barbell or a low bar. - Alternatively, do seated rows with a resistance band. ## Loading and Rep-Modification Options - **Sweat:** - Row/Ski: 2:00, Box Step-Ups: 16/8, Kettlebell: 12/8, Ring Rows: 8 reps. - **Train:** - Row/Ski: 3:00, Box Step-Ups: 20 reps, Kettlebell: 16/12, Ring Rows: 10 reps. - **Compete:** - Row/Ski: 3:00, Box Step-Ups: 20 reps, Kettlebell: 24/16, Ring Rows: 10 reps. ### Strategy Advice - Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout each round. It’s better to go slower and keep good form than to rush and risk injury. - Break the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows. - Stay hydrated and listen to your body; if you need to take a breather, that’s perfectly okay! Alright, team! Let’s get ready to crush this WOD with quality and focus. Remember, it’s all about the journey, not just the finish line. Let’s have some fun!
